result.execSummary:
All charges against Shuntia Marie Jones in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shuntia Marie Jones is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shuntia Marie Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shuntia Marie Jones in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Shuntia Marie Jones in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Final pre-trial held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 8/10/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing set for 6/23/22 at 1:30 pm. At the request of defense, case is removed from the calendar. Defense no longer wishes to be heard as to bail/bond issues.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Shuntia Marie Jones in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shuntia Marie Jones in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counesl requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Jamell M. M. and
J.M.K.M. (3/22/22)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shuntia Marie Jones in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Shuntia Marie Jones in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shuntia Marie Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
